profileAlternative.name: Justin Lee
profileAlternative.headline: Java Champion and Principal Software Engineer at Red Hat
profileAlternative.summary:
I have experience building web-based applications with involvement ranging from design to implementation and occasional Swing development. I'm a contributor to several open source projects and am interested in solving complex problems. Learning is a key goal for me so I'm not afraid to tackle new projects in unfamiliar spaces.

Specialties: Java, Hibernate, SQL, WebSockets, Spring, Kotlin, MongoDB

aboutAlternative.text:
I have experience building web-based applications with involvement ranging from design to implementation and occasional Swing development. I'm a contributor to several open source projects and am interested in solving complex problems. Learning is a key goal for me so I'm not afraid to tackle new projects in unfamiliar spaces.

Specialties: Java, Hibernate, SQL, WebSockets, Spring, Kotlin, MongoDB

positions.title: Principal Software Engineer
positions.description: Working with the openwhisk serverless framework and related technologies.

positions.title: JSR 356: JavaTM API for WebSocket Expert Group
positions.description: Member of the expert group standardizing a websocket API for Java EE 7.

positions.title: Member of Technical Staff
positions.description:
* Member of the JVM drivers team
* Maintainer of the Morphia ODM for MongoDB (https://github.com/mongodb/morphia)
* Helped develop and maintain the MongoDB Connector for BI which allows SQL-based business intelligence tools to connect to MongoDB and build visualizations as if the data were in a relational database.
* Helped develop and maintain the mongo-hadoop connector which allows Hadoop-based applications run directly against MongoDB
…
see more

positions.title: Senior Software Engineer
positions.description:
* Implemented the websockets wire protocol on top of the grizzly
* Helped develop and maintain various protocol level features as needed by the Glassfish application server
* Maintained the configuration system exposed by grizzly and used by Glassfish

positions.title: Principal Member of Technical Staff
positions.description:
* Worked on various backend components
* Implemented functions to import user content from third party sites
* Helped maintain social network broadcast features
* Helped rewrite site traffic analysis and statistics

positions.title: Staff Engineer
positions.description:
* Implemented the websockets wire protocol on top of the grizzly
* Helped develop and maintain various protocol level features as needed by the Glassfish application server
* Maintained the configuration system exposed by grizzly and used by Glassfish

positions.title: Senior Developer
positions.description: Senior developer building enterprise software monitoring and end-user experience management software. Technogies in use include Wicket, Spring, and Hibernate.

positions.title: Owner and CEO
positions.description: Contracted with a variety of clients building systems as needs dictated.

positions.title: Sr. Software Architect
positions.description:
* Helped develop and maintain the Communication Engine which was the point of contact between our system and the various back end systems used by various banks.
* Led the refactoring of the Communication Engine to increase the stability and extendability of the system to address new integrations with different bank mainframe systems.
* Maintained the system used to generate our model code based on the Rational model built by the domain experts
…
see more

items: MongoDB Persistence with Java and Morphia
WebSocket and Java EE: A State of the Union
WebSocket and Java EE: A State of the Union
The Not-Java That's Not Scala: Alternatives for Java EE Development
Building Websocket Based Applications on GlassFish/Grizzly
Building Websocket Based Applications on GlassFish/Grizzly

peopleAlsoViewed.text: Program Manager (Developer Advocacy, Google Developer Studio) at Google
US infrastructure dev lead at Nomura Securities, Oracle Java Champion, Pluralsight author Twitter @vgrazi
Java Champion, Microsoft MVP, TDC Rockstar, Developer, Professor, and Enabler
Java Champion | Software Architect at Liferay, Inc.
